ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Powerex Corp. FERC Rate Schedule No. 1

record_data.record_title: Powerex Corp. FERC Rate Schedule No. 1
record_data.record_plain_text:
POWEREX CORP.
FERC RATE SCHEDULE NO. 1
1. Availability: Powerex Corp. ("Powerex") makes available electric energy and capacity under this Rate Schedule for wholesale sales in the United States ("U.S.") to any purchaser with whom Powerex has contracted. Powerex has been authorized to transact at market-based rates in the Energy Imbalance Market administered by the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO"). Powerex Corp., Letter Order issued in Docket No. ER10-3297-011 (Mar. 29, 2018) (unpublished letter order). Powerex may also make available the following ancillary services to purchasers under this rate schedule: RTO/ISO Specific:
PJM: Regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
New York: Regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
New England: Regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc.
California: Regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the CAISO and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO.
MISO: Regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. ("MISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO.
Southwest Power Pool: Regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Southwest Power Pool, Inc. ("SPP") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to SPP.
Third-Party Provider:
Third-party ancillary services: Seller offers Regulation Service, Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service, Energy and Generator Imbalance Service, Operating Reserve-Spinning, Operating Reserve-Supplemental, and Primary Frequency Response Service. Sales will not include the following: (i) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; and (ii) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier. Sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except where the Commission has granted authorization. Sales of Regulation and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except at rates not to exceed the buying public utility transmission provider's OATT rate for the same service or where the Commission has granted authorization.
2. Applicability: This Rate Schedule is applicable to all sales of energy, capacity and ancillary services at wholesale in U.S. interstate commerce by Powerex to customers not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule of Powerex. 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Powerex. With respect to sales in U.S. organized markets, such rates shall be as permitted by Commission-approved tariffs and market rules. 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between purchaser and Powerex. With respect to sales in U.S. organized markets, such terms and conditions shall be consistent with the terms and conditions applicable to such sales under Commission-approved tariffs and market rules. 5. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Powerex shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Powerex's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Powerex to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Powerex's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any other orders of the Commission concerning Powerex's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of the tariff. 6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: The Commission granted Powerex the following waivers and blanket authorizations: (i) waiver of Parts 41, 101, and 141 of the Commission's regulations; (ii) waiver of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations, except for Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; (iii) waiver of the Federal Power Act Section 205 filing requirements and code of conduct requirements for transactions with affiliated utilities in foreign commerce; (iv) exemption from the Commission's quarterly reporting requirements for sales in foreign commerce or within Canada; (v) limitation of the requirements of FPA Section 203 to dispositions by Powerex of jurisdictional facilities located within the United States; (vi) blanket approval as to Section 204 of the Federal Power Act and Part 34 of the Commission's regulations for all future issuances of securities and debt and assumptions of liabilities; and(vii) limitation of the requirements of Part 34 of the Commission's regulations to the issuances of securities or assumptions of liabilities by Powerex within the United States. See British Columbia Power Exchange Corp., 80 FERC 61,343 (1997); British Columbia Power Exchange Corp., Letter Order in Docket No. ER97-4024-012 (issued Sept. 12, 2000); Powerex Corp., Letter Order in Docket No. ER01-48-002 (issued Oct. 30, 2003); Powerex Corp., and Letter Order in Docket No. ER01-48-007 (issued July 26, 2007). Seller is authorized to make sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental services to NorthWestern Corporation, doing business as NorthWestern Energy, to satisfy NorthWestern Energy's Montana open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers. See Powerex Corp., 150 FERC 61,145 (2015). 7. Effective Date: This Rate Schedule shall be effective on the date specified by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. 8. Seller Category: Powerex is a Category 1 Seller in the Southwest, Central, Southwest Power Pool, Northeast, and Southeast Regions, and a Category 2 Seller in the Northwest Region, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a).
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing to March 29 Letter Order
